itl.enabler.api

Interface Attendant.AttendantEventListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Attendant.AttendantEventAdapter
    Enclosing class:
    Attendant

    public static interface Attendant.AttendantEventListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    Event Listener for the Attendant class

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onInitialFloatRequired(java.util.EventObject ev)
      This event is fired when a new attendant period is opened (created).
      void onLogOff(AttendantLogOnOffEventArgs ev)
      This event is fired when a attendant logs off a Pump/Forecourt.
      void onLogOn(AttendantLogOnOffEventArgs ev)
      This event is fired when a attendant successfully logs on to the Pump/Forecourt.
      void onPeriodStateChange(java.util.EventObject ev)
      This is event is fired when an attendant period is opened, closed or marked as reconciled.
      void onStatusChanged(AttendantStatusEventArgs ev)
      This event is fired when the attendant status has changed.

      • onInitialFloatRequired

        void onInitialFloatRequired(java.util.EventObject ev)
        This event is fired when a new attendant period is opened (created).
        Parameters:
        ev - indicates the method called by the API when an Attendant InitialFloatRequired event occurs

      • onLogOff

        void onLogOff(AttendantLogOnOffEventArgs ev)
        This event is fired when a attendant logs off a Pump/Forecourt.
        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • onLogOn

        void onLogOn(AttendantLogOnOffEventArgs ev)
        This event is fired when a attendant successfully logs on to the Pump/Forecourt.

        See Also:

      • onPeriodStateChange

        void onPeriodStateChange(java.util.EventObject ev)
        This is event is fired when an attendant period is opened, closed or marked as reconciled.
        Parameters:
        ev - indicates the method called by the API when an Attendant PeriodStateChange event occurs

      • onStatusChanged

        void onStatusChanged(AttendantStatusEventArgs ev)
        This event is fired when the attendant status has changed.

        Note : Currently this is used only for the Block status. In the future this event will indicate other status changes, so always check the AttendantStatusEventType parameter.

        Parameters:
        ev - indicates the method called by the API when an Attendant StatusChanged event occurs
        See Also:
        AttendantStatusEventArgs, AttendantStatusEventType, Attendant.getBlockReason()
